author: .fjl
content: I just had a call with <@!552133098075193354>, <@!574864862338088960> and Ratan Sur about EIP-1559. Just wanted to clarify where we stand regarding geth integration. We have an open PR for it, which we reviewed a bit. The PR is too complicated right now and we will need to redo it. There are some open questions on our side about the EIP:

author: .fjl
content: (1) The block gas elasticity is required by the EIP, but I think moving the limit to 2x current gas limit at the time of fork is a bit much. We agreed that it might be better to set it less high initially.

author: .fjl
content: (2) There is no definitive TX scoring function in the EIP. It would be nice to define one. This would really simplify the txpool implementation.

author: .fjl
content: We also talked about improving block propagation. Long term, we will need to improve it in order to allow for larger blocks. One idea that came up is to add a network operation that fetches a selected subset of block transactions. This would help with propagation because the full nodes will have most of the transactions anyway.

author: .fjl
content: I think it would be nice to have this in general because it also provides some incentive to send TXs in public before including them in a block (if you just publish a full block with transactions that were unknown to everyone else before, propagating this block will be much slower)
